Through feeding her hogs three times a day, she can gain better profits because she can offer them at a greater price. She believes she can attain her goal for her family, which is to provide them with a better way of living and save some money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy feed for her livestock

loans.name: Richel

texts.en:
Richel's goal in life is to harvest good crops every season. Her goal will lead her to gain more income and give a better way of life for her family. Richel and her husband have run a rice farming business in their village for 11 years. 

Richel has three children who are in school. She and her husband are helping each other to improve their living standards and bring their family out of poverty. They are a hard-working couple. 

Richel is in need of additional assistance to maintain the business. She is requesting a loan of 40,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy fertilizers, herbicides, insecticides and seeds for farming. Richel hopes that she can manage her business well until her children attain a college level of education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicides, insecticides and seeds for farming.

loans.name: Joaquin

texts.en:
Joaquin is happy to live with his wife and four children. Most of the residents in their village are farmers. Joaquin is one those farmers whose primary source of income is from growing rice. Joaquin is 33 years of age and has been engaged in farming for almost 14 years. 

Joaquin patiently manages his business because he has no other source of income for he and his family to live on. He has no chance for other employment because he did not finish his education. Joaquin has the perseverance to work for the future of his children. He wants them to go to college when the time comes. 

Due to insufficient funds from farming, Joaquin is asking for a loan of 25,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy fertilizers and seeds. He hopes that someday he will give a better future to his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for his farm.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 38 years old, married and has three children. She raises pigs at home for resale at the markets. She has had three years experience with this type of business. She is taking out a loan to purchase two more hogs to raise, vitamins and feeds. Her loan amount, PHP20,000, would be a great help in maintaining her business as well as in improving the family's lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase two more hogs to raise, vitamins and feed.

loans.name: Estrelita

texts.en:
"Dedication and wise management of business" are the guiding principles that push Estrelita to strive for a better way of living. Estrelita is married to a farmer, having four grown up children. Among her four children, two have settled into marriage already; one is working and the other one is still studying.

Estrelita works hard in order to earn her living. She owns and runs her variety store within her local community. She has been engaged in this kind of business for almost seventeen years. She is grateful because her previous loan has really helped her in maintaining her business and making it grow continuously. At this time, she is asking for bigger capital, amounting to PHP50,000, which will be used to buy groceries such as canned goods, cooking oil, detergent soap, beverages, candy, ingredients and biscuits to re-stock her store. In this way, she can encourage more customers to buy her merchandise and to satisfy her customers' demands to her. She is hoping that this amount will eventually help her in obtaining her goal.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as canned goods, cooking oil, detergent soap, beverages, candy, ingredients and biscuits for the store.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo is a 48-year-old married man, residing in Sta. Luciana, Cauayan city. 

To earn a living, Reynaldo operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, planting and harvesting rice for sale. He has been in this business for 25 years. Every cropping season, he earns 25,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) doing this type of business. 

He has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and rice seedlings. In the future, Reynaldo wants to improve his family's living conditions and lift them out of poverty.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and rice seedlings.

loans.name: Bernando Antonio

texts.es:
Bernardo es una persona muy trabajadora que gracias a esta cualidad ha podido salir adelante con su familia. Bernardo se encuentra casado y es padre de 2 hijos a quienes siempre les ha querido ofrecer una buena educación. Desde hace aproximadamente 8 meses, por adversidades que le presentó la vida con su antiguo empleo, Bernardo montó su propio negocio el cual le permite generar los ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia. Bernardo en su tienda general ha ido incorporando poco a poco con el paso del tiempo más productos de la canasta familiar, y de esta manera ha ido montando su negocio con mayor variedad de productos para sus clientes. Gracias al buen servicio que ofrece Bernardo su clientela ha ido aumentando con el paso del tiempo, lo que le ha permitido aumentar sus ventas y seguir progresando junto con su familia. Gracias a que sus ventas son muy buenas, Bernardo ha tenido que ir aumentando su inventario de productos, es por esto que dado el poco capital que tiene, busca un préstamo que le permita acceder a la compra de productos de la canasta familiar para aumentar el inventario de productos que ofrece a sus clientes.

Bernardo sueña con seguir aumentando sus ingresos para ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Espera poder ofrecerles a sus 2 hijos el ingreso a una educación universitaria donde se preparen y obtengan un empleo bien remunerado.
texts.en:
Bernardo is a very hard-working person and, as a result, he has been able to make progress with his family.  Bernardo is married and has two children to whom he has always wanted to offer a good education.  Eight months ago, owing to difficulties in his job, Bernardo set up his own business which allows him to make income with which to support his family.  Over time, he has gradually added more basic household products to his general store and increased the variety of products that he offers his customers.  Thanks to Bernardo's good customer service, he has managed to increase his business and his sales.  This has allowed him to make progress with his family.  Thanks to the fact that he has good sales, Bernardo has had to increase his stock of goods.  As he doesn't have much capital, he is looking to take out a loan which will enable him to buy basic household products and thereby increase his stock.

Bernardo dreams of continuing to increase his income so that he can offer his family a better quality of life.  He hopes to be able to offer his two children a university education so that they can train professionally and then obtain a well-paid job.

loans.use: to buy basic household products for his store

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is a determined person who strives hard to move her family out of poverty. She is blessed with two children. Sonia had a difficult childhood and her parents worked very hard for things. Since then, she has followed into her parent's small business selling slippers and bags. 

Sonia is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to purchase additional products to sell such as plastic ware. Her loan will generate a higher income that will be sufficient to meet her family's needs. Sonia will save for her children's future and she hopes they will be spared life's difficulties.

loans.use: to purchase plastic ware to sell

loans.name: Narcita

texts.en:
Narcita is the loving mother of one child who is in school. She is 39 years old and married. Narcita has been engaged in the farming business for almost six years. She is enjoying this type of business, since it is her family's main source of income. Narcita’s husband is her partner in growing their business of planting and harvesting rice on their farm. 

Narcita and her husband are diligently managing their farming business to ensure that they will earn an income from every crop. The couple is doing some field activities to lessen their expenditure in farming and to be able to cover their daily needs. 

With regards to their farming business, Narcita is requesting a loan of 40,000 PHP to buy fertilizers, seeds to plant and herbicides for plant care. She hopes to have good crops and to earn an income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds to plant and herbicides for plant care.

loans.name: Alejandro Antonio

texts.es:
Emprendedor es la mejor palabra para caracterizar a Alejandro, un joven de 21 años de edad que se encuentra estudiando y laborando para generar sus propios ingresos y contribuir a sus padres con los ingresos de su hogar. Alejandro se dedica desde hace 3 años aproximadamente a la comercialización de vinos y aperitivos de vino. Su negocio lo inició gracias a que una conocida suya es la dueña de una empresa de licores de la ciudad y esta le vende los vinos y Alejandro se encarga, bajo su responsabilidad, de la comercialización de estos. Alejandro es reconocido por ser una persona muy amable y por ofrecer muy buen servicio, además de que se le conoce por su gran carisma y siempre querer ofrecerles un bienestar a todas las personas que lo rodean. Gracias a que Alejandro tiene muy buenos clientes, cuenta con un gran pedido por parte de uno de ellos que no alcanza a satisfacer con el inventario que cuenta actualmente, es por esto que con el fin de responder a su cliente con el pedido, Alejandro busca un préstamo que le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de vinos y aperitivos de vino para cumplir con un gran pedido que le ha hecho un cliente suyo.

Alejandro espera poder seguir aumentando sus ventas y poder incrementar más la capacidad de su negocio. Además, ya quiere empezar a comercializar los vinos en otros municipios de modo que pueda generar empleo para personas vulnerables que requieran de unos ingresos y no hayan encontrado oportunidades laborales. Alejandro sueña con tener una muy buena calidad de vida junto a su familia, donde les pueda ofrecer a sus padres una buena estabilidad económica, además, quiere culminar sus estudios y poder continuar con su negocio hasta convertirlo en una gran comercializadora.
texts.en:
"Entrepreneur" is the best word to describe Alejandro, a young man of 21 who is studying and working to generate his own income and contribute to his parents' household income. Alejandro has worked for about three years selling wines and wine-based aperitifs. He began his business through a friend who is the owner of a liquor business in the city. She sells him the wines and Alejandro is in charge of marketing them. Alejandro is known for being a very friendly person who offers very good service, in addition to which he is known for his great charisma, and he always wants to offer a sense of well-being to the all the people who surround him. Thanks to having many good customers, he has a large order from one of them, and he doesn't have enough in his present inventory to satisfy it. This is why, with the aim of responding to the customer with the order, Alejandro is looking for a loan that will offer him the possibility of buying the wines and wine-based aperitifs to fill the large order that his customer has placed.

Alejandro hopes to be able to continue increasing his sales and further expanding the capacity of his business. In addition, he wants to begin selling wine in other towns so that he can generate work for vulnerable people who need income and have not found work opportunities. Alejandro dreams of having a very good quality of life with his family, where he can offer his parents good economic stability. Furthermore, he wants to finish his studies and be able to continue with his business until he converts it into a big commercial enterprise.

loans.use: to buy wines and aperitifs to fill a large order that a customer has placed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a seam sealing machine so that he can make shoes more efficiently

loans.name: Nit's Group

texts.en:
Nit, 37, is a mother of three children who depend on her and all of them are still in school. She lives in a rural area located in the Thmor Koul district, of Battambang province in Cambodia where farming is common for a living. She is a local farmer of 1.5 hectare of farmland and she has been in this business for 10 years to support her family.

Nit received her first loan from Kiva's field partner, VisionFund, one year ago and she completely repaid the loan with VisionFund. Since 2011, the loan has helped her family's conditions improve. Now she is leading a group of four members to apply for a loan of KHR 1,000,000 each. As the leader, she will use this loan to buy fertilizer for her dry season rice on her 1.5 hectare of land. She hopes that she will gain more income for her family and that she can keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy seed and fertilizer for farmland

loans.name: Lubna's Group

texts.en:
Lubna is 25 years old and recently married. She supports her husband in his livestock business. Her husband sells milk to community clients. He gets up early in the morning to milk the cows and then sells that milk for a very reasonable price. Lubna's husband offers very good quality milk an that is why he earns good income from his business. Lubna helps take care of the business and she feeds the cattle and keeps the stalls clean.

Lubna is requesting a loan from the Kiva partner Asasah to assist the family business and purchase a dairy cow. This will increase the quantity of milk her husband can provide and help him to fulfill client needs. Lubna's husband has been operating his business for many years and she is very confident that his business will become more successful as a result of her loan. In this photo, the woman holding the Asasah passbook is Lubna.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Ismael

texts.en:
Ismael is 55 years old and says that he is still strong and able to do field activities to minimize his farm expenditures. He is the father of five and works hard to provide for his family's needs. Ismael has had his share of problems and different encounters in life, but he has not lost his faith in God and has faith that he will surpass his difficulties. 

Ismael is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan to buy fertilizers and herbicides for his farm to sustain his large rice crop and provide for all of his farm inputs. He hopes to use his loan and maintain his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicide

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is 33 years old, married and blessed with one child. He is a farmer while his wife is an Overseas Filipino Worker in Hong Kong. Joel and his child meet their needs daily through his wife's remittances. Joel teaches himself and his child to be careful with their expenditures because living without the mother on their side is difficult. At present, Joel performs as mother and father of his child.

Joel wants to live happily with his wife. He will work harder to have financial stability so his wife will no longer go back to work abroad.

Due to costly farm inputs at present, Joel is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 for additional working capital for his farm. He will use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizers to maintain the business. Joel wishes to have productive crops, earn a higher income and save some of it. In the future, Joel will be having financial stability while he is operating his farming business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en: Mary Ann is 30 years old and is married, with three children. To earn a living, Mary Ann engages in buying and selling gasoline in the village of Maligaya. Right now, Mary Ann is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 7,000 to purchase more gasoline to resell. She hopes that she can get the amount she requested to further develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase more gasoline to resell

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.en:
Maria Cristina is 53 years old, a very enduring person who works as a manicurist and pedicurist in the village. She offers good service and that’s why she has gained very loyal customers. As part of her service, she walks house to house and offers door to door service. She is very much thankful because with her unending patience she has slowly lifted up her family.


At present, she is asking for a loan of 6,000 pesos to buy new nail polish, a pusher, a nipper and cuticle remover as new supplies to be used in her service. She hopes that this loan will make it possible for her to provide the necessities for her family and improve their living situation.

loans.use: to buy new nail polish, a pusher, a nipper and cuticle remover as new supplies used in her service

loans.name: Sreymoeun's Group

texts.en:
Sreymoeun is 35 years old, married, and has three children who attend school. She and her husband live in a village in the Thmor Koul district. Her husband is a newspaper agent while she sometimes works for others to better earn a living.  Sreymoeun earns about $4 per day to feed her family and saves $1 a day. 

Sreymoeun’s group has been with VisionFund for six years and this group repaid their prior loan with VisionFund. The loan helped her afford sufficient food and allowed her to send her children to school. 

Her group of two members is requesting another loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she wants to use this entire loan to buy a bed for her family. This loan will enable her to have a decent bed as a household asset for the family.

loans.use: to purchase a bed for her family

loans.name: Maricris

texts.en:
Maricris is 34 years old and is a hardworking mother and a responsible village member. She lives in the village of San Antonio in the province of Isabela. Her husband is an overseas worker. 

Maricris opened a grocery ten years ago and she earns 300 PHP daily from her business. Maricris is requesting a 35,000 PHP loan to purchase snack foods, drinks, cooking oil, spices, and other products that she can offer in her community. She hopes that expanding her business will help her husband provide for the family’s daily needs.

loans.use: to buy snack foods and drinks for her retail business.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix is married with four children that he is sending to school. His wife is a housekeeper. Felix is a farmer working in the Philippines and his major crop is rice, which he sells to traders during harvesting. Felix is a humble person, especially to his wife and neighbors. In order to finance his farm, Felix borrows from the traders even at a high interest rate. He has no choice because he does not have enough capital to cover all of his farm expenses. 

Felix is requesting a 40,000 PHP loan to buy farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizer, and insecticide. He believes his loan is a great opportunity.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticide

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 40 years old and blessed with two children. Her husband is deceased and her youngest child is still studying. Remedios needs to be responsible and work hard to make sure her children can finish their schooling. Remedios works selling snacks, perfumes and accessories in her allotted place in the market.  

Remedios is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase additional products such as perfumes, accessories, and snacks. She wants to generate a higher business profit to provide for her children by doubling her selling efforts. Remedios needs to be strong to provide her children with a good life despite her difficulties.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, accessories, and snacks

loans.name: Joselyn

texts.en:
Joselyn is 37 years old and engaged in the selling of different foods she processes every day. For three years of doing such business, she has lived with her two children. She is dreaming that her children will find employment someday so she pursues the education of her loving children.


She usually processes meat and sells it. To make sure that her products are good, she marinates them. She is requesting a loan of P15,000 to purchase meat and ingredients needed in processing such as salt, sugar, and pepper. With her loan, she hopes to earn better income to be able to offer her two children a good education and economic stability because she does not want them to have to face the hardship she’s had.

loans.use: to purchase meat and ingredients needed in processing it such as salt, sugar, and pepper

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en: Margarita is married and has two children. She buys and sells pigs. Margarita has been in this business for ten years and is successful in it. At this time, she has three pigs. She wants to receive a loan in the amount of 6,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She hopes that in the future, she will make her business grow as she continues to manage her business well.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Aydee Maricela

texts.es:
La señora Aydee tiene 36 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene tres hijos. Desde hace 17 años ella se dedica a la agricultura, aprendió esa actividad por que era madre soltera, desde entonces todos sus cultivos de granos los realizo ella junto con sus hijos. También Aydee se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, pollos y a la comercialización de esos animales.

Ella compra los insumos agrícolas y todo tipo de concentrado en una comunidad que esta a siete kilómetros de donde ella vive, todos los días miércoles ella sale temprano de su casa a comprar todo lo necesario para sus animales.

El préstamo que solicita la señora Aydee es para comprar una bomba de riego de veneno y comprar cuatro cerdos para engordarlos, y luego venderlos. De esa forma ella se ahorrara el pago del alquiler de la bomba que utiliza para regar la milpa que siembra y dispondrá de más animales para negociar, lo que le permitirá obtener mayores ingresos. 

Ella desea que sus hijos continúen estudiando, para que sean unos profesionales, ya que la vida de ella en el campo ha sido difícil, considera que si lograra sacar a sus hijos adelante con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Aydee is 36 years old.  She lives with her partner and has three children.  She has been working in agriculture for 17 years.  She learned this activity because she was a single mother and has since grown her grain crops together with her children.  She also raises pigs and chickens which she later sells.

Aydee buys her farming supplies and all kinds of concentrated feed in a community seven kilometers away.  Every Wednesday she leaves home early to buy everything she needs for her animals. 

Aydee is requesting this loan to buy a pump for spraying weed killer and four pigs to fatten and then sell.  This will save her money as she currently rents a pump to spray the corn that she grows.  She will also have more animals which will enable her to make more income.

Aydee would like her children to continue studying and become professionals because her life in the countryside has been difficult.  She believes that she will manage to help her children make progress in their studies.

loans.use: to buy a pump for spraying weed killer and to buy four pigs to fatten

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en: Lucena is 49 years old, married and has two children. She has been involved in her piggery business for more than four years. She primarily fattens up and sells them at a profitable price. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 pesos to buy feed, medicines and vitamins for her pigs to maintain their healthiness. Hopefully, this will provide a better result of income soon.

loans.use: to buy feed, medicines and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Nget's Group

texts.en:
Nget, 50, is married with five children. Three of her children are factory workers in Thailand. She earns a living through her pig raising business as the primary source of income while rice milling and working for pay are for extra income for her family. She has been in these businesses for 10 years.

This is the third loan for Nget's group and they successfully paid back the loans with VisionFund. The past two loans have helped her to earn more income for her family. Now, Nget and her group members are requesting a loan of KHR 1,000,000 each. As the leader, she will use the entire loan to buy pig feed. With this loan, she hopes to make a better living and gradually expand her businesses.

loans.use: To buy pig feed

loans.name: Carmenza Idalia

texts.es:
Carmenza inició con su negocio hace aproximadamente 3 años con el ánimo de contribuir a los ingresos de su hogar. Dado que el salario que gana su esposo no es suficiente para sostener todos los gastos de su hogar, Carmenza decidió montar su propio negocio de venta de helados en su propia casa para aportar un poco y poder tener una buena calidad de vida. Carmenza, madre de 4 hijos, siempre ha querido poder ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, sin embargo muchas adversidades que se ha presentado en la vida le han puesto la tarea muy difícil. Carmenza atiende su venta de helados desde su casa y gracias a la buena atención que presta sus ventas han ido aumentando. Quiere poco a poco logar un buen reconocimiento para su negocio, por lo que quiere adicionar a la venta de helados, la venta de confites, dulces, galletas, y variedad de snack, con el fin de atender mejor a la clientela de niños y jóvenes. Debido a que no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar la compra de estos productos a su proveedor Carmenza aspira a que un préstamo le brindará la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de productos como confites, dulces, galletas, golosinas, para adicionar a la venta de helados. 

Carmenza espera que de esta manera sus ingresos aumenten considerablemente pues venderá más productos a sus clientes. Carmenza sueña con que su negocio pueda ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a toda su familia y le permita tener una estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Carmenza started her business approximately three years ago as she was keen to contribute to household income. As her husband didn’t earn enough to pay for all the home expenses, Carmenza decided to open an ice-cream selling business in her own home so she could contribute a little and have a better standard of living. The mother of four children, she has always wanted to offer her family a better quality of life. However, many problems have come along making the task very difficult. 

Carmenza always gives good service to her customers so sales have increased. Now she wishes to make the store even better known by adding further items such as candy, sweet items, cookies, and other snacks which will appeal to her younger customers. As she doesn’t have enough money to make these purchases, she hopes a loan will enable her to buy these items.

Carmenza hopes that her earnings will increase as a result of these purchases. Her dream is to have the income from the business provide a better quality of life to her whole family as well as a more stable financial outlook.

loans.use: to buy candy, sweet items, cookies, and other snacks

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn, a 39-year-old mother of five children, is the operator of a motorcycle service that has been in operation for seven years. She is working hard every day just to meet the needs of her family.

Jocelyn has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 (Philippine pesos) to buy wheels and gasoline for the maintenance of her transport motorcycle. She hopes to increase her profits so that she can sustain the financial needs of her family, to improve their standard of living, and save money for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy wheels and gasoline

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza peacefully resides at Pussian with her spouse and three children. Her husband is a farmer and Liza is also involved in the business and works to help her husband generate income. Liza prays for the absence of a typhoon or drought as producing rice is greatly affected by climate changes. 

Liza is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to maintain her crop by purchasing fertilizer and insecticide to ensure good growth and nutrition. Her goal is to save funds to use for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Jaqueline

texts.es:
Jaqueline es una madre soltera cabeza de familia de 1 hijo de 4 años a quien siempre le ha tenido que brindar el sustento por su propia cuenta, pues su padre nunca ha contribuido con un aporte económico para su sostenimiento. Jaqueline en vista de que debía generar los ingresos para su hogar, comenzó vendiendo productos de uso personal a través de catálogos, y gracias a esto generaba los ingresos suficientes para el sostenimiento de su hijo. Poco a poco ha ido mejorando su negocio, y ahora ha podido tener una miscelánea en la que ofrece productos de uso personal como implementos de aseo, accesorios para dama y también productos de papelería, gracias a esto sus ventas han aumentado considerablemente y su hijo ha podido gozar de una mejor calidad de vida. Con el ánimo de tener su negocio con un buen nivel de inventario de papelería para el inicio de la temporada escolar, Jaqueline quiere surtir su miscelánea con estos productos, sin embargo no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar la compra de estos productos a sus clientes. Es por esto que Jaqueline tiene la esperanza en que un préstamo le brindará la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de productos de papelería como cuadernos, cartulinas, lapiceros, borradores, entre otros, y poder tener un buen surtido para el inicio de la temporada escolar. 

Jaqueline espera que su negocio siga aumentando las ventas para poder seguir sacando adelante a su hijo, además, sueña con que su hijo pueda acceder a una educación de calidad y en un futuro a una educación universitaria.
texts.en:
Jaqueline is a single mother and head of the family, with one four-year-old child whom she has always needed to support on her own as his father has never contributed anything financially towards his support.

On seeing that she needed to generate income for her household, Jaqueline started selling personal care products through catalogs.  Thanks to this, she generated sufficient income to support her child.  Bit by bit, she has been able to improve her business, and now she has been able to open a miscellany store where she sells personal care products for such as grooming tools, women's accessories, and also stationery products.  Thanks to this, her sales have increased considerably, and her child has been able to enjoy a better quality of life.

With the intent of having her business well-stocked with stationery inventory for the start of the school year, Jaqueline wants to stock up her miscellany store with these products.  However, she doesn't have sufficient capital to undertake the purchase of these products for her customers.  It is for this reason that Jaqueline has the hope that a loan will give her the possibility of being able to purchase stationery products such as notebooks, cards, pens, and scratch pads, among other things, and she will be able to be well-stocked for the start of the academic year.

Jaqueline hopes that her business' sales will continue to grow, so that she can continue moving her child ahead in life.  Additionally, she dreams that her child will be able to receive a quality education, and in the future attend university.

loans.use: to purchase stationery products such as notebooks, cards, pens, and scratch pads, among other things, and she will be able to be well-stocked for the start of the academic year.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is engaged in selling malagkit (sticky rice) dishes such as kutsinta (rice cake), puto (steamed rice cake) and bibingka (rice cake with coconut milk) in the village. She is 55 years old and has been involved in this activity for more than four years. It provides a good income for her family. Due to the improvement of their lifestyle, she wants to continue and expand this business. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 as additional working capital to purchase malagkit and sugar to develop her stated business.

loans.use: to purchase malagkit and sugar

loans.name: Remelyn

texts.en:
Remelyn is 29 years old and married to Alex, a village farmer. Due to the high cost of basic commodities, she runs a variety store to increase their income and provide for necessities. Remelyn is a woman who has the determination to become successful in the future. 

Remelyn is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan to buy soft drinks, vegetables, noodles, beverages, and junk food to sell. She hopes that her loan will improve her business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, vegetables, noodles, beverages and junk food

loans.name: Mamarasul

texts.ru: Мамарасул трудолюбивый и целеустремленный человек. Он очень добрый семьянин и на воспитании имеет четверых детей. Более 4 лет он занимается выращиванием семечек. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес, чтобы получить хорошую прибыль для того чтобы покупать оргтехнику для обучения своих детей и внуков. Он и его дети имеет среднее образование, и он решил чтобы его внуки стали образованными и хорошими специалистами. Мамарасул запрашивает займ в размере 10000 Сомони для покупки минеральных удобрений и семян подсолнечника.
texts.en: Mamarasul is a hardworking and goal-oriented person.  He is a very kind family man, who is raising four children.  He has been involved in growing seeds for over four years.  He wants to expand his business in order to make a good profit and buy computer equipment to teach his children and grandchildren.  Mamarasul and his children have a secondary education, and he decided that his grandchildren needed to become educated and good specialists.  Mamarasul is requesting a loan in the sum of 10,000 Somoni to buy mineral fertilizers and sunflower seeds.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and sunflower seeds

loans.name: Blanca Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Blanca tiene 51 años de edad, es viuda y tiene tres hijos. Toda su vida se ha dedicado a la comercialización de mariscos tanto secos como frescos. Esa actividad la aprendió de sus padres, quienes desde pequeños le enseñaron a trabajar con los mariscos. Ella compra los mariscos al mayoreo a los pescadores de la localidad.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo es para comprar pescado fresco, ralearlo y secarlo, para venderlo en la temporada de semana santa. Ella quiere aprovechar en este momento ya que el precio del pescado es bajo y puede comprar mayor cantidad de pescado. Al tener mayor venta la señora obtendrá más ingresos que le permitan cubrir los gastos familiares y tener un comercio constante.

Blanca espera que con su trabajo y con la ayuda de Fundación Campo, terminar de construir su casa que ya tiene un 60% de avance, para trasladarse a vivir a su casa propia, ya que actualmente vive donde un familiar.
texts.en:
Señora Blanca is 51 years old. She is a widow and has three children. She has worked all her life selling seafood, dried as well as fresh. She learned this business from her parents, who taught her since she was a little one how to work with seafood. She buys the seafood wholesale from the local fishermen.

The loan that she is requesting from Fundación Campo will be used to buy fresh fish, clean them, and dry them to sell during Holy Week. She wants to take advantage of this time, since the price of fish is low and she can buy a larger quantity of fish. If she has greater sales, she will have more income, which will allow her to cover the family expenses and have a steady business.

Blanca hopes that with her work and the help of Fundación Campo, she can finish building her house, which is already 60% completed, so that she can move into her own house, since she now lives with a relative.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam dreams of lifting her family out of poverty. She is 42 years old. She operates a small store in which she sells different products. She has been in this business for nine years and usually earns 300 Philippines pesos (PHP) a day. Profits earned are used for allowances and food, and serve as revolving capital in the business. 

Miriam's business needs additional products to sell in order to increase profits. Thus, she is now asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy canned goods, bakery bread, sugar, coffee and other ingredients to sell.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, bakery bread, sugar, coffee and other ingredients to sell

loans.name: Gretchen

texts.en:
Gretchen is 26 years old and married with two children. She was married at a young age because, due to poverty, she was not given the opportunity to finish a college degree. Gretchen does not want her children to suffer the same fate. She works hard with her husband to generate income from their farm. The couple manages a hectare rice field on which they grown and sell rice. Although this is their sole income source, they are very proud that they have a reputable source of income. 

Gretchen is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and insecticide to make their farm more profitable. She hopes to someday improve her family's living conditions and achieve financial stability.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 36 years old and married with four children whom she sends to school. The family's income comes from raising crops, primarily rice. Nida and her husband have been farmers since their marriage ten years ago. 

Nida is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to buy fertilizer and insecticide to improve and sustain her crop. In the future, she hopes to have abundant harvests to allow her to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Dalia

texts.es:
La socia anteriormente se dedicaba al trabajo de docente,pero ahora se esta ddicando al negocio de venta de ropa,ella vende pantalones,chompas,blusas y polos,ella vende en forma independiente,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender la ropa.La socia  solicita el préstamo para comprar pantalones,polos,blusas y chompas.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member previously worked as a teacher, but now she manages a business selling clothes. She sells trousers, sweaters, blouses, and polo shirts. She works independently and adheres to a schedule that runs from 8am to 5pm. Through this business, the member is able to help her children move forward. Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell clothes.

The member is requesting a loan to buy trousers, polo shirts, blouses, and sweaters. She is pleased with the loan that has been provided and promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy trousers, polo shirts, blouses, and sweaters.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma is 53 years old, an industrious mother of three. She is one of the sellers of "malagkit" in the village. She has been doing this for five years and provides her family allowances every day. She is requesting 15,000 pesos to buy flour, "malagkit" (sticky rice), coconut milk and cassava as additional ingredients to cook. Hopefully, these components will contribute to a delicious outcome of her foods so that they will be in demand. In this way, she could earn higher income.

loans.use: to buy flour, "malagkit" (sticky rice), coconut milk and cassava

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 34 years old. She owns and manages a general store to generate income, while her husband manages their rice farming business. She has operated this business for two years and usually earns a profit of PHP 7,000 a month, which she usually spends for their basic necessities.

Rowena plans to increase her product offerings to satisfy her customers' needs, but due financial difficulty, she is asking for an additional capital of PHP 20,000 to buy soft drinks, canned goods, sugar, oil, soap, bread, shampoo and candies to sell in her store. She mentioned that this loan will help her to improve the business and make her dream come true.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, canned goods, sugar, oil, soap, bread, shampoo and candies to sell in her store

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana, aged 51, is in the business of buying and selling rice in her home. It is her advantage because as she operates her business, she also performs household chores. She has never neglected her four children though she had her source of income. 


The fact is, she cared so much for them because she provided them nice allowances through her business.  To accommodate more income, she is requesting a loan of P15,000 to buy 15 sacks of rice. She hopes that with her business, she can support the necessities of her family and lift them from poor living conditions.

loans.use: to buy 15 sacks of rice

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.en:
Gerardo's goal in life is to provide a good education for his two children. Though their living standard is less than fortunate, he still thinks positive thoughts on how to improve his family's living conditions. He is very thankful for a supportive wife and children. 

Gerardo's source of income comes from selling the crops he raises. He has been in the rice farming business for 20 years now. He is asking for a loan of P20,000 to buy fertilizers, insecticides and pesticides used in farming. Gerardo hopes to make his output more productive. He would like to see all his children with professions someday. 

Gerardo will achieve success with perseverance and hard work.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides and pesticides used in farming

loans.name: Cristeta

texts.en:
Cristeta is 46 years old. She is married to Alfeo who is a farmer and a part-time construction worker. They have three children, two of whom are still in high school. The couple has been managing a farming business for over 10 years now. They plant and harvest rice to sell. Cristeta would like to improve their crop production and increase their earnings. She also needs to improve their farming practices. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy three liters of MAGNUM (insecticide) and five bags of fertilizer to use in farming. She hopes this loan will be given to her as a way to improve their output. In return, Cristeta will pay her loan on time. 

Someday, she hopes to continuously finance the college education of her children so they became professionals in their chosen career.

loans.use: to buy nsecticides and fertilizers

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena is married and a loving mother of five children. She is 45 years old and a very hard working woman. For the last 22 years, she has been selling and repairing watches at the market. 

Filomena is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy new watches, parts of watches, accessories and bracelets. This loan would increase her sales and attract customers to boost her income. She hopes that she can improve their living conditions in order to feel a less burdensome life.

loans.use: to buy new watches, parts of watches, accessories and bracelets

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby is 37 years old, married, and has two children. To earn a living, Ruby is engaged in a retail shop business. She usually offers her products house to house, using her transport motorcycle. The profits earned from her business allow her to pay her family's monthly electric bill and to provide their daily needs. 

In this regard, she plans to improve her business and to make it a viable source of income. Because of insufficient capital, she is asking for an additional PHP 40,000 to buy house wares, accessories, plastic ware and clothes to sell. She believes that she can improve the business through her patience and strong determination.

loans.use: to buy house wares, accessories, plastic ware and clothes to sell

loans.name: Ma. Liexlyn

texts.en:
Ma. Liexlyn is an innovative person who owns a sari-sari (variety) store business and works independently. She is married to an industrious man who can support her and yet she prefers to have her own source of income because she wants to experience a good quality of life and not depend on her husband.


At the age of 26, she already has one child. This makes her continue her started business. The eagerness to provide a comfortable life for her child caused her to request a loan amount of P10,000 to purchase merchandise such as sugar, milk, and soft drinks to stock her store. This should give her the opportunity to earn higher income.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as sugar, milk, and soft drinks

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Rice farming is the business of Dolores. She is 56 years old, widowed and has four children. Two are settled into marriage. Despite her age, she still works hard to make a living and carries the burden alone in providing for the needs of the family. Dolores pays for laborers to help her plant and harvest rice. 

She is now asking for a loan to pay for laborers for land preparation and transplanting of rice seedlings. She asks for P10,000. 

Dolores is also praying for good health to continuously manage her farming business and someday achieve improvements on her family's financial problems.

loans.use: to pay for laborers for land preparation and transplanting of rice seedlings.

loans.name: Noralyn

texts.en:
Noralyn is 43 years old and is responsible and very dedicated to her family. She always looks out for the best possible things for her three children and her children are her inspiration for working hard every day. Noralyn runs a business selling peanuts, popcorn, coco juice, and banana chips. She walks daily, selling under the sun or in the rain. This is how she dedicates herself to her family.

Noralyn is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan to buy coconuts, popcorn, peanuts, and sugar. She hopes that her loan will generate a better income with which to provide for her family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy coconuts, popcorn, peanuts, and sugar

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben is a rice grower in the village where they live. This is the family's primary source of income. He has been in the farming business for 25 years now. He has four children and two of them attend school. Aside from being a responsible father, he also serves the comnmunity as a "Barangay" (smallest unit of the community) official. He is ready to serve his community anytime with all his effort. 

Ruben would also like to improve his crop production to save funds for the education of his children so he is asking for a loan of P30,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming. Someday, with good income from the business, he will achieve financial stability. He also prays for good health for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming

loans.name: Salma's Group

texts.en:
Salma has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband’s spare parts business. He sells auto vehicle spare parts to his clients at reasonable rates. He also provides repair services to his customers and is known for his good quality work.

With the loan investment, he will buy spare parts of different brands and some repair tools to offer even better quality services to his customers and increase his income.

Salma works in people's houses to financially support her husband. She is a mother of two children. Both of the children are illiterate as Salma couldn’t afford their education. 

She is hopeful that a loan investment will help her husband make more profits from his business and be able to send her children to school.

loans.use: To buy spare parts to sell

loans.name: Lina

texts.en: Lina is 46 years old and sells grocery items in her village. She has two children who are currently studying, so the eagerness to earn a high income every day is in her. She wants to stock additional commodities in her store to attract customers.  For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy in-demand groceries such as coffee, rice, canned goods and detergent soap. She hopes to continue expanding her business because it is doing well.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Khalida Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Khalida has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her brother’s business of selling fruit. He will rent a small piece of land on which he will grow different seasonal fruits to sell at a profit. He will also buy fertilizers to get better quality fruit from his land. He is a very hard-working person and has been operating his business for many years. 

Khalida is divorced and lives with her brother. She is a mother of a 3-year-old son who has not started his education yet. She didn’t want to become a burden on her brother and that’s why she sews clothes for her neighboring clients.

She is hopeful that the loan will be a very productive one for her brother's business.

loans.use: To rent a plot of land to grow fruit on for sale

loans.name: Las Azucenas De Barrio Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama las azucenas del barrio  está  conformado por  once integrantes  personas trabajadoras y humildes.
Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la señora  Marisol una señorita trabajadora  que se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos y a la venta de quesos.
Ella nos cuenta que le gusta mucho negocio por que le deja buenas ganancias y así pude seguir trabajando su dinero.
Le gusta mucho preparar lo que es tacos dorados  enchiladas, entomatadas y empanadas de pollo, quesillo y chorizo.
Pidió el préstamo para la compra de más ingredientes como es: maíz para  la elaboración de tortillas, chile verdes, chile secos, jitomate, cebolla, pollos y  verduras.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son:
Deddy-quien se dedica a la venta de quesos.
Adelina Agustina -quien se dedica a la venta de club nutrimental.
Antonia Austreberta-quien se dedica a la venta de abarrotes.
Enedina-quien se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Alberta Lorenza-quien se dedica a la venta de perfumes.
María Magdalena-quien se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Leticia-quien se dedica a la venta de perfumes.
Emir Jonathan-quien se dedica a la venta de quesos **no aparece en la foto***
Epifanía-quien se dedica a la venta de productos naturistas.**aparece en la foto con blusa morada, pero no se ve su cara**
Guillermo-quien se dedica a la venta de cocina económica.
Le dan las gracias a fundación por el apoyo que les ha dado para  salir adelante y cumplir sus sueños y así mejorar sus vidas y sus pequeños negocios.
texts.en:
This group is called “Las Azucenas del Barrio” (The Lilies of the Neighborhood) and consists of 11 hardworking and humble individuals.

One of the members of this group is Sra. Marisol, a hardworking woman who sells Mexican street food and cheeses. She says that she greatly enjoys her business because it generates good income. Therefore, she continues to work for the money. She enjoys preparing golden tacos, enchiladas, entomatadas, chicken empanadas, soft cheeses, and chorizo sausage. Marisol is requesting a loan to buy more ingredients such as corn for preparing tortillas, green chiles, dried chiles, tomatoes, onions, chicken, and vegetables.

The other members of the group are as follows: • Deddy sells cheeses. • Adelina Agustina sells nutritional club products. • Antonia Austreberta sells groceries. • Enedina sells clothing. • Alberta Lorenza sells perfumes. • María Magdalena sells clothing. • Leticia sells perfumes. • Emir Jonathan sells cheeses. (He is not in the photo.) • Epifanía sells natural products. (She is in the photo wearing a purple blouse, but her face is hidden.) • Guillermo sells kitchen ranges.

They would like to thank Fundación Realidad for the support that has been given to them so that they can move forward and fulfill their dreams. As a result, they will be able to improve their lives and their small businesses.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for preparing her dishes.

loans.name: Ameeran's Group

texts.en:
Ameeran has requested a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her sewing business. With the loan investment, she will buy a new sewing machine because her current machine has gone rough and she is unable to finish the orders on time.

She is a mother of a son and two daughters. Her son operates a fruit selling business while her daughters are getting their education.

Ameeran is a very efficient and active lady. Along with her business, she also performs her household tasks very well. She is confident about her business' success after investing the loan.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo is 40 years old, married and has two children. Reynaldo's parents have given capital to continuously operate the family's carinderia (food stall selling daily meals and snacks) business. This serves as his inheritance from them, which he has been managing for two years now. He pours all his efforts and skills into cooking delicious viands and snacks. Reynaldo's wife also helps him run the business. 

He is now requesting a loan of PHP 35,000 to buy ingredients for food preparation such as onions, pork and chicken meat to cook and sell.

In the future, he hopes to further develop and improve his sales in the business to pay tribute to his parents' goodness. This will also alleviate his family's poor living conditions.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for food preparation

loans.name: Abida's Group

texts.en:
Abida is 33 years old. She is very active and performs her household duties very well by staying at home. She also operates a sewing and decorative embroidery business from her home. Due to her good quality services and skills, she receives regular orders every month.

Her husband has a business making iron boxes. He is an iron smith and makes boxes out of iron on order. His products are of the highest quality and are very durable.

Abida is the mother of a son and two daughters. Her son is the eldest one and is studying in class 2 while her daughters are not of school-going age yet.

Abida has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her embroidery business. With a loan investment, she will buy embroidery frames, beads and other raw material in bulk quantity that will allow her to prepare better looking clothes and increase her orders and profits.

loans.use: To buy beads and embroidery thread for embroidery business.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her embroidery business. She is very fond of embroidery and prepares beautiful looking clothes for her community clients at very reasonable rates. With the loan investment, she will buy embroidery materials in bulk quantity such as beads, thread, embroidery frames to improve her products and services.

She has given birth to seven children. Five of her children are studying and the others remain at home.

Nasreen is a very active lady and performs her household duties very well along with her business. She is very confident that her business will grow in a positive direction as a result of investing the loan.

loans.use: To buy thread and beads

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 20 years old and married with one child. She sells food to earn a living, and she has been in the business for six years.  When she was 15, she already selling "chicharon" (pork rinds), fried peanuts and banana chips. She already feels the adversities of engaging in this business and wants to look for a better job but the hindrance is her educational background. She was not be able to finish college so she just continued her started business; after all it was profitable.


Now, she is asking for a loan amount of P10,000 to purchase additional products to sell such as peanuts, popcorn and "chicharon".

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell such as peanuts, popcorn and pork rinds.

loans.name: Jackie

texts.en:
Jackie is 26 years old, married and blessed with four children. She operates a retail store where she sells household necessities such as sugar, cooking oil, salt and detergent soap. She has been involved in this business for three years and contributed a good impact into their lives. 

She is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy additional products to offer such as juice, eggs, soft drinks and noodles. These goods would provide her more than her usual income every day. Then, she would be able to build a better and stronger store.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chairs and tables to equip the premises where he sells fast food and make them more attractive to customers.

loans.name: Hedil Roberto

texts.es:
Hedil tiene 36 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos en el caserío Guaraguaos Alto ubicado en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura desde hace más de diez años, él siembra mango, para lo que cuenta con 1.5 has de terreno de cultivo, cerca a su casa, el conoce muy bien esta actividad gracias a las enseñanzas de su padre. Adicionalmente también cría animales menores como; ovinos, porcinos, y pavos que una vez que alcancen el peso y tamaño ideal los ofrece a los comerciantes de los mercados. Con los ingresos que percibe solventa los gastos económicos de su familia.

 Hedil desea adquirir alimentos balanceados para su ganado y pesticidas para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de mango, con esta acción el espera obtener una buena cosecha. Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2300 nuevos soles. Hedil es una persona bastante tranquila y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es poder crecer como empresario y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Hedil is 36 years old, married, and lives with his wife and three children in the village of Guaraguaos Alto, which is located in the District of Tambogrande. This agricultural area is situated in Piura Province in the region of the same name and is more than four hours away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

Hedil has performed farm-related work for more than 10 years. He grow mangoes and has 1½ plots of land that he has cultivated near his home. Hedil is very knowledgeable about his work thanks to what his father had taught him. In addition, he raises small animals such as sheep, pigs, and turkeys. Once the animals reach the ideal size and weight, he offers them to the vendors at the markets. With the income he generates, he is able to cover his family's expenses.

Hedil wants to acquire balanced feed for his livestock and pesticides for maintaining his mango crop. As a result, he hopes to obtain a good harvest. For this reason, he needs to request from Edpyme Alternativa a loan in the amount of 2300 PEN. Hedil is a peaceful and responsible individual. His greatest wish is to grow as a businessman and move forward.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Luz Dary

texts.es:
Muchas adversidades se le han puesto en el camino de Luz Dary, sin embargo sus ganas de trabajar y de salir adelante le han permitido superar las dificultades y progresar junto con su familia. Hace menos de 1 año, Luz Dary tuvo que abandonar su municipio natal debido a los grandes conflictos de violencia que existían, y se desplazó hasta el municipio de La Unión con el ánimo de poder encontrar allí una mejor calidad de vida. En su municipio tenía junto con su esposo un negocio de billares y un vehículo de transporte, lo que le generaba los ingresos para su hogar, pero las extorsiones hicieron que el negocio no fuera rentable y tuvieron que abandonarlo. Luz Dary es madre de una hija de 1 año que nació con deficiencias óseas y de la piel, una enfermedad poco común según los médicos. El esposo de Luz Dary se quedó viviendo en un municipio cercano al de su municipio natal con el ánimo de seguir trabajando el vehículo de transporte, pues el emigrar hasta el municipio de La Unión era muy riesgoso porque no sabía a qué se podrían dedicar allí. Luz Dary mientras encontraba un empleo fijo, se dedicó a la venta de pescados tocando cada puerta del municipio, y al ver que con este negocio podría generar un buen ingreso, decidió seguir aumentando sus ventas en este. Es por eso que ahora Luz Dary esta buscando comprar una cava de poliestireno expandido donde guardar sus pescados y un mayor surtido de pescados que se los envían desde su municipio natal. Sin embargo, como no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta compra, Luz Dary busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de un mayor surtido de pescados y una cava de poliestireno expandido para guardar sus pescados.

Luz Dary espera poder seguir aumentando sus ventas para poder mejorar su condición de vida y la de su hija, además espera que su esposo pueda encontrar un empleo en el municipio de La Unión para poder desplazarse desde el municipio donde se encuentra trabajando para estar nuevamente junto a su esposa y su hija. Luz Dary sueña con volver a tener un buen negocio y que este no lo tenga que dejar por dificultades ajenas a su interés, además de poder generar empleo para personas que estén en la misma situación de necesidad que ella.
texts.en:
A lot of adversity has been put in Luz Dary's way, but her willingness to work and get ahead have allowed her to overcome difficulties and progress with her family. Less than a year ago, Luz Dary had to leave the town she was born in due to the amount of violent conflict there was there. She moved to the city of La Unión to seek a better quality of life. In her town, she and her husband had a billiards hall and a transport vehicle, which generated income for their home, but extortion made it so the business wasn't profitable and they had to abandon it. Luz Dary is the mother of a one year old girl who was born with bone and skin deficiencies, a rare disease, according to the doctors. Luz Dary's husband stayed behind to live in a town close to thee town they were born in to keep working with the transport vehicle, because migrating to the city of La Unión was very risky because they didn't know what they would do there. Meanwhile, Luz Dary found a steady job selling fish knocking on every door in town. When she saw that this business could generate good income,   she decided to keep increasing her sales. That is why now Luz Dary is seeking to buy an expanded styrofoam cooler where she can keep her fish. as well as a a greater variety of fish that are sent from the town of her birth. Nonetheless, since she doesn't have enough capital to make the purchase, Luz Dary is seeking a loan to afford her the opportunity to access the purchase of a greater quantity of fish and an expanded styrofoam cooler to keep her fish. 

Luz Dary hopes to keep increasing her sales to improve her and her daughter's quality of life. She also hopes that her husband can find a job in the town of La Unión so he can move from the town he is working in to be with his wife and daughter again. Luz Dary dreams of having a good business again and that she won't have to close it due to reasons that go against her own interests. She also hopes to be able to generate employment for people who are in the same needy situation she has been in.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of fish and a styrofoam cooler to keep her fish.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana devotes her full time in operating her variety store. She has been in this business for 10 years. With this regard, she is thankful because her husband is supportive in improving the business they manage. While she is busy running her home-based store, her husband is also busy operating his transportation business.

She and her husband had been blessed with four children.Two of the children are currently studying, one is already married and the other one is working. Rosana aims to make her small store into a mini grocery so that she can support her two children in their studies. She doesn't want her children to experience what she had to go through during her school days. So, to make her goal possible, she is doing her best in order to increase the profits being generated from her variety store. Rosana would like to request for bigger capital in the amount of PHP50,000 which will be use in buying a complete set of merchandise to re stock her store and satisfy her customers' demands. By doing this kind of business strategy, she can be able to have a productive business. In addition, she can achieve a better way of living.

loans.use: to buy a complete set of merchandise for her variety store.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy has had 37 years of experience in the rice farming business. His long duration in managing the business improves his techniques to gain more income. His experience as a farmer makes him firm and wise.
 
Jimmy is 57 years old, married and has three children. Through farming, Jimmy is able to send his children to school. He is happy that all of his children are graduated and hold a degree. His testimony on how he did it is just a combination of love, patience and hard work.

Jimmy is having financial difficulties in sustaining his farm. He has decided to borrow a loan of PHP20,000 to buy fertilizers and seeds for his farm. He believes that he will surpass his problems by borrowing this amount. He hopes that he will succeed as a farmer and small entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for his farm.

loans.name: Sughran's Group

texts.en:
Sughran has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband’s business of painting houses. He makes contracts with different construction companies and building owners and paints those buildings on order.

With the loan investment, he will buy different colors of paint boxes and paint brushes to be able to fulfill the clients' demands and to increase his orders and profits.

Sughran is very experienced in his business. He is hopeful that the loan investment will bring positive changes to his business and he will increase his income.

loans.use: to buy paint boxes and brushes for paint business.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Luz Marina;la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de elaboración de mermeladas de diferentes sabores como fresa, mango, sauco, durazno entre otros y de esta forma tener más variedad que ofrecer a sus clientas, la socia trabaja de forma ambulatoria y a pedido ella vende a sus amistades y familiares que le solicitan,siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos (frutas)para la elaboracion de mermeladas para su negocio 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This is Sra. Luz Marina. She divides her time between her daily activities and her business of making marmalades of different flavors such as strawberry, mango, elderberry, peach, and other fruits. This enables her to have more variety to offer to her customers. Luz Marina sells as a traveling vendor and by taking orders. She sells to her friends and relatives who request her products. By working in this manner, she is able to help her family move forward.

Luz Marina is requesting a loan so that she can buy supplies (fruits) for preparing marmalades to sell in her business. She is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy fruits for making marmalade.

loans.name: Judi Maribel

texts.es:
Judi siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajadora y dedicada al bienestar de su familia. Desde hace aproximadamente 8 años trabaja en la actividad de la confección y es reconocida por la buena calidad de sus productos. Judi anteriormente trabajaba en un taller de confección, y su jefe le propuso que se independizara que el le otorgaba un lote de trabajo para que así tuviese mayores ganancias. Judi entonces montó su propio taller de confección donde con un gran esfuerzo ha conseguido la maquinaria necesaria. Cuenta con dos grandes clientes, los cuales le realizan grandes cantidades de pedidos, por lo que Judi siempre ha tenido un buen volumen de trabajo. Debido a que una de las máquinas con las que trabaja Judi hace un fuerte ruido, quiere hacerle el mantenimiento respectivo a la máquina. De esta manera podrá mejorar las condiciones en las que trabaja, sin embargo, no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar este mantenimiento, por lo que busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a realizar el mantenimiento de una de sus máquinas de confección.

Judi espera que de esta manera pueda seguir trabajando sin inconvenientes en su taller y pueda seguir mejorando su negocio. Judi sueña con que su esposo y su hijo tengan una mejor calidad de vida y puedan tener una estabilidad económica. Además, sueña con que su taller crezca y pueda generar empleo para madres cabeza de familia que no tengan oportunidades laborales.
texts.en:
Judi has always been known as a hard-worker who is devoted to her family’s well-being.  She has been working in her sewing business for approximately eight years, and she is recognized for the good quality of her products.  Judi previously worked in a seamstress shop.  Her boss proposed that she become independent.  He gave her a batch of work in order to have greater earnings.

Judi then set up her own sewing shop where, with great effort, she has gotten the necessary machinery.  She has two large customers.  They make big quantities of orders, therefore Judi has always had a good volume of work.  

Due to the fact that one of the machines that Judi works with makes a loud noise, Judi wants to provide maintenance on the machine.  This way she will be able to improve her work conditions.  However, she does not have enough money to have the maintenance done.  That is why she is looking for a loan to perform maintenance on one of her sewing machines.

Judi hopes that this way she will be able to continue working without any inconvenience at her shop.  She hopes that she will be able to continue improving her business.  Judi dreams of her husband and her son having a better quality of live and financial stability.  She also dreams of her shop growing and being able to generate employment for mothers who are heads of their households and have no work opportunities.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on one of her sewing machines.

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr:
Kossi est un homme âgé  de 24 ans. Il est célibataire.
Kossi travaille comme couturier  depuis 2006. Il exerce son activité dans un quartier de la place. Il sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter de la machine à coudre afin de mieux répondre à la demande de la clientèle. 
Dans les prochaines années, Kossi voudrait être un couturier de renom et fonder plus tard sa famille.
texts.en:
Kossi, age 24, is single. Since 2006, he's been working as a dressmaker in a neighborhood of the place where he lives.

He's seeking his first loan to buy a sewing machine in order to better meet customer demand. 

In the forthcoming years, Kossi would like to become a renowned tailor and, later, start a family.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and accessories

loans.name: Akoua

texts.fr:
Akoua est une femme âgée de 40 ans. Elle est marié å un chauffeur. Elle a 3 enfants.
Akoua travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2011. Elle tient un débit de boissons pour tous clients dans sa boutique. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la concurrence.
Akoua a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des boissons. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Akoua voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Akoua, age 40, is married to a driver and has three children. Since 2001, she's been working as a reseller.

She runs a bar for every kind of customers in her shop. She gets her supplies in Lomé and works alone. At this time, her main challenge is competition.

Akoua is seeking her first loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to purchase beverages. She wants to reinvest in her business.

In the forthcoming years, she would like to expand her business. She says that she intends to use her profits to take care of her family.

loans.use: to purchase beverages

loans.name: Attissovi

texts.fr:
Djifa est un homme âgé de 32 ans. Il est marié å une revendeuse. Il a un enfant. 
Djifa travaille comme revendeur depuis 2009. Il vend des produits congelés et d’alimentation générale pour tous clients dans sa boutique. Il achète les produits à Lomé. Il travaille seul. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la concurrence.
Djifa a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits congelés et d’alimentation générale. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Djifa voudrait agrandir son activité. Il dit qu’avec les profits, il prévoit d’assurer les besoins vitaux de sa famille.
texts.en:
Djifa, age 32, is married to a reseller and has one child. Since 2009, he's been working as a reseller.

In his shop, he sells food staples and frozen products to any kind of customer. He gets his supplies in Lomé and works alone.

At this time, his main challenge is competition. Djifa is seeking his first loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to purchase frozen products and food staples.

He wants to reinvest in his business. In the forthcoming years, he would like to expand his business. He says that he intends to use his profits to provide for his family's vital needs.

loans.use: to buy food staples and frozen products

loans.name: Savoern's Group

texts.en:
Savoern is a villager in the Thmor Koul district, Battambang province, and the 50-year-old mother of four children. 

She is responsible for only two children while the other two are workers. She and her husband have been working as house builders for eight years. They can earn about $9 US dollars per day. 

This is her first loan with VisionFund. As the group leader, she will use the entire loan to buy more equipment for her house construction service such as timber, a needle, cement, etc. She hopes to have a big house, earn more income to set aside for the future, and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy more equipment for her house construction business.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is 56 years old and is a loving mother of three children. Her husband already left this world, so she usually stays at her house alone. For this reason, she thinks of a business that would not bore her while at the same time she could earn.

She is now in the buy and sell business, particularly in different kinds of fruits. To make her business successful, she is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 as additional working capital to buy bananas, mangoes, and citrus. She will sell them at a more profitable price in order to save for her future.

loans.use: to buy bananas, mangoes, and citrus.

loans.name: Maricella

texts.es:
Maricella es una madre soltera cabeza de familia de 1 hijo de 6 años a quien ha podido sacar adelante gracias a su dedicación por el trabajo. Maricella ha trabajado durante gran parte de su vida la venta de productos de uso personal a través de catálogos, sin embargo, hace aproximadamente 3 años cuando el padre de su hijo dejó de contribuir con los ingresos para su hogar, tuvo que buscar la manera de generar mayores ingresos. De allí montó una tienda de calzado, donde además sigue ofreciendo los productos de uso personal. La tienda la tiene ubicada en su residencia lo que le permite atender a su hijo mientras trabaja. Maricella es reconocida por la buena atención que ofrece a sus clientes y por la buena calidad de sus productos, y gracias a esto ha podido captar una muy buena clientela, algunos de ellos, compran sus productos al por mayor. Actualmente tiene un gran pedido por parte de un cliente que no alcanza a satisfacer con el inventario que tiene, por esto debe hacer la compra de la mercancía a su proveedor para satisfacer el pedido de su cliente. Debido a que no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar la compra a su proveedor, Maricella busca un préstamo que le permita acceder a la compra de productos de calzado para satisfacer un gran pedido que le ha hecho un cliente.

Maricella espera que de esta manera sus ingresos aumenten considerablemente, pues podrá seguir trabajando en su negocio con más capital que antes. Además, sueña con que su hijo pueda acceder a una educación de calidad y pueda tener en un futuro una estabilidad económica, para que no tenga que pasar por las dificultades que pasó ella.
texts.en:
Maricella is a single mother and head of her family, with one six-year-old child whom she has been able to advance in life thanks to her dedication to her work.

Maricella has worked for the greater part of her life selling personal care products through catalogs.  However, when the father of her child stopped contributing money to the household about three years ago, she needed to search for a means of generating greater income.  From that point, she set up a shoe store where she continues also to offer personal care products for sale.  Her store is located in her home, which allows her to look after her child while she is working.

Maricella is well-known for the good service that she provides her customers, and for the good quality of her products.  Thanks to this, she has been able to capture a very good customer base, some of whom purchase her products at wholesale.  She currently has a large order on behalf of a customer which she cannot cover with her current inventory.  For this reason, she must purchase the merchandise from her supplier in order to be able to meet her customer's order.  As she doesn't have sufficient capital to make this purchase from her supplier, Maricella is looking for a loan that will allow her to make this purchase of footwear, in order to meet the large order that her customer has placed.

Maricella hopes that in this way her income will grow considerably, as she will be able to continue working on her business with more capital than before.  She also dreams that her son might achieve a quality education and have financial stability in the future, so that he won't have to experience the difficulties that she has had to.

loans.use: to purchase footwear to meet a large order that a customer has placed.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie, aged 36, operates a sari-sari (variety) store as a source of income. She has been blessed with four children so she needs to be responsible and hardworking to provide them with a good life. Through her business she produces income, which she gives as allowances to her school-aged children.
 
Now she is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase additional goods to stock in her small store. Hopefully, she will produce higher than her previous income to save for the education of her children and uplift their living conditions as well.
